revised_title: Radium Emanations and Their Effects on Diamond
tldr: The author investigates the effects of radium emanations on diamonds and discovers that they cause a superficial darkening, converting the surface into graphite. Radium emanations also alter the body color of the diamond, changing it from yellow to a pale blue-green. This phenomenon is due to the intense phosphorescence of the diamond in the presence of radium, which may be a result of chemical as well as physical action.
